subject: RE: [junit] how to test for compile error?
msgSnippet: ... javac is implemented in Java, so you could also directly call its main method. You might want to take a look at how the Ant javac task is implemented. Hope
messageBody:
> That said, I suppose that you could rig up a test that calls
> java.lang.Runtime.exec("javac " + filename) on a number of
> pre-existing
> *.java files that will trigger the expected compilation error.

javac is implemented in Java, so you could also directly call its main
method.

You might want to take a look at how the Ant javac task is implemented.

Hope this helps, Ilja
